intro: Sabatia harperi, commonly known as the purpletop or harper's sabatia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Sabatia harperi plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and floral adaptations.
